name: Rajasthan
description: The land of kings, Rajasthan is renowned for its magnificent palaces, imposing forts, colorful festivals, and rich cultural heritage. From the pink city of Jaipur to the golden city of Jaisalmer, every corner tells a story of valor and grandeur.

name: Uttar Pradesh
description: Home to the iconic Taj Mahal and numerous UNESCO World Heritage Sites, Uttar Pradesh is the heartland of Indian culture and spirituality. The state boasts of ancient temples, magnificent monuments, and sacred ghats along the Ganges.

name: Kerala
image: /kerala.jpeg/God, gold and lagoons_ a snapshot of Kerala, India â€“ in pictures.jpeg
description: God's Own Country, Kerala is blessed with serene backwaters, lush greenery, and a rich tradition of art and culture. The state features beautiful temples with unique Kerala architecture, ancient churches, and peaceful mosques.

name: Tamil Nadu
description: Tamil Nadu showcases the magnificent Dravidian architecture through its towering gopurams and intricate stone carvings. The state is home to some of India's most ancient temples, each telling stories of devotion spanning millennia.

name: Karnataka
description: Karnataka features diverse architectural styles from Hoysala temples to Vijayanagara monuments. The state showcases rich cultural heritage through its palaces, temples, and historical sites that span different dynasties.

name: West Bengal
description: West Bengal is home to some of India's most revered temples and spiritual sites, reflecting centuries of devotion and architectural brilliance. The state blends traditional Bengali culture with colonial heritage.

name: Maharashtra
description: Maharashtra is renowned for its ancient rock-cut caves, magnificent forts, and diverse religious architecture. From the caves of Ajanta and Ellora to the hill stations of the Western Ghats, the state offers rich cultural experiences.

name: Gujarat
description: Gujarat showcases a blend of ancient and medieval architecture through its temples, stepwells, and palaces. The state is known for its vibrant culture, business acumen, and architectural marvels like the Somnath Temple.

name: Delhi
description: The capital territory of Delhi is a treasure trove of historical monuments spanning different eras. From Mughal architecture to British colonial buildings, Delhi represents the confluence of various cultures and dynasties.

name: Punjab
description: Punjab, the land of five rivers, is the spiritual center of Sikhism. The state is home to the magnificent Golden Temple and numerous other gurudwaras that showcase Sikh architecture and hospitality.

name: Telangana
description: Telangana showcases a rich blend of Islamic and Hindu architecture through its historic monuments, temples, and palaces. The state features magnificent structures from the Kakatiya and Qutb Shahi dynasties.

name: Andaman and Nicobar Islands
description: These pristine islands feature unique colonial architecture, historic churches, and monuments that reflect the diverse cultural heritage of the indigenous tribes and colonial settlers.

name: Puducherry
description: The former French colony showcases beautiful colonial architecture, ancient temples, and churches that blend French and Tamil cultures in perfect harmony.

name: Andhra Pradesh
description: Andhra Pradesh is renowned for its ancient temples, Buddhist sites, and architectural marvels that span from the Satavahana period to the Vijayanagara empire.
